title: Hot Tea or Hot Air? Immunomodulatory Effects of Panax Ginseng in the Prevention of Cancer
abstract: Panax ginseng is used in traditional Chinese medicine as a prophylactic, a stimulant, and a treatment for various diseases. In addition, ginseng has been found to enhance the immune system and possess an anti-tumor effect. Ginseng appears to stimulate humoral and cell-mediated immune responses and the subsequent increase in titers of lymphocytes and circulating antibodies. Furthermore, ginseng's cancer-prevention properties seem to be mediated through the increased production of interferons and cytokines, which activate natural killer and cytotoxic T-cells that can served to lyse or inhibit growing tumors. Both clinical and epidemiological studies indicated that Panax ginseng can reduce the incidence of cancer in vivo. These results suggest that ginseng shows antitumor effects as an immunomodulator.
explanation: This paper explores the immunomodulatory effects of Panax ginseng in the prevention of cancer, which is a new angle that is partially dependent on the previous findings regarding ginseng's effects on the body.
